Submodules

news_app.admin module

news_app.api_views module

news_app.api_views.api_article_detail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/articles/<id>/

  • Retrieve a single article.

  • Readers can only retrieve approved articles.

PUT /api/articles/<id>/

  • Update article (editors/journalists).

  • Journalists can only edit their own articles.

  • Only editors can set approved=True (signals will notify).

DELETE /api/articles/<id>/

  • Delete article (editors/journalists).

  • Journalists can only delete their own articles.

news_app.api_views.api_articles(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/articles/

  • Returns all approved articles.

POST /api/articles/

  • Creates an article (journalists only).

  • Supports image upload (multipart/form-data).

news_app.api_views.api_articles_subscribed(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/articles/subscribed/

  • Returns approved articles from the reader’s subscriptions.

  • Readers only.

news_app.api_views.api_newsletter_detail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/newsletters/<id>/

  • Retrieve a newsletter.

  • Readers see only approved articles nested.

PUT /api/newsletters/<id>/

  • Update newsletter (editors/journalists).

  • Journalists can only update their own newsletters.

DELETE /api/newsletters/<id>/

  • Delete newsletter (editors/journalists).

  • Journalists can only delete their own newsletters.

news_app.api_views.api_newsletters(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/newsletters/

  • Return newsletters.

  • Readers see newsletters with only approved nested articles.

POST /api/newsletters/

  • Create newsletter (journalists only).

news_app.api_views.api_publisher_detail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/publishers/<id>/

  • Retrieve a single publisher.

  • Any authenticated role can view.

news_app.api_views.api_publishers(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
GET /api/publishers/

  • Return a list of publishers.

  • Any authenticated role can view.

news_app.apps module

class news_app.apps.NewsAppConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

App configuration for the News Application.

Signals are imported in ready() to register receivers at startup.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'news_app'
ready()[source]

Override this method in subclasses to run code when Django starts.

Bases: ModelForm

Form to create/edit articles.

  • publisher is optional (independent article)

  • article image is optional (photo upload)

clean()[source]

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

news_app.models module

class news_app.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Article model representing a news article submission.

Required fields: - title, content, author, created_at, approved, publisher.

Association rule: - Every article is authored by a journalist. - publisher is optional:

  • publisher is null => independent article

  • publisher set => publisher content

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

image

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class news_app.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user with role-based behavior and subscription fields.

Roles (required): - Reader: can view articles/newsletters and subscribe to

publishers/journalists.

  • Editor: can review/approve and manage content.

  • Journalist: can create and manage articles/newsletters.

Reader subscriptions: - subscribed_publishers: Many to many of Publisher subscriptions. - subscribed_journalists: Many to many to journalists (users).

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = (('reader', 'Reader'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'))
ROLE_EDITOR = 'editor'
ROLE_JOURNALIST = 'journalist'
ROLE_READER = 'reader'
articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

In the example:

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

Bases: Model

news_app.signals module

news_app.signals.on_article_saved(sender, instance: Article, created: bool, **kwargs)[source]

On article save, if approval transitioned from False to True: - email subscribers - post to X

news_app.signals.track_previous_approval(sender, instance: Article, **kwargs)[source]

Track the previous approved value before saving.

This allows detection of the approval transition: False -> True

news_app.tests module

class news_app.tests.NewsAppTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Automated tests for the News Application.

Covers: - Token-authenticated API access per role. - Reader subscription filtering. - Journalist article/newsletter creation. - Editor approval triggers email + X post (signals). - Publisher and Newsletter API endpoints.

setUp()[source]

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_api_articles_returns_only_approved()[source]
test_api_articles_subscribed_reader_only()[source]
test_editor_approval_triggers_signal_email_and_x(_mock_x)[source]

Approving an article should trigger: - email excerpt+link sent to subscribers - X post attempted (mocked)

test_journalist_can_create_article()[source]
test_journalist_can_create_newsletter()[source]
test_newsletters_endpoints_reader_filters_unapproved_articles()[source]
test_publishers_endpoints()[source]
test_reader_cannot_create_article()[source]

news_app.urls module

news_app.urls_api module

news_app.views module

news_app.views.approve_article(request, article_id)[source]

Approve an article. Signals will notify subscribers and post to X upon approval.

news_app.views.article_create(request)[source]

Journalists can create new articles. New submissions start as approved=False and await editor review.

news_app.views.article_delete(request, article_id)[source]

Delete an article. - Editors can delete any article. - Journalists can delete their own articles.

news_app.views.article_detail(request, article_id)[source]

Article detail view. Readers can only access approved articles.

news_app.views.article_edit(request, article_id)[source]

Edit an article. - Editors can edit any article. - Journalists can edit only their own articles. - Journalist edits reset approval to False.

news_app.views.article_list(request)[source]

List articles. - Readers see only approved articles. - Editors and journalists can see all.

news_app.views.editor_queue(request)[source]

Queue of pending articles for editors to review.

news_app.views.ensure_groups_and_permissions()[source]

Ensure that the Readers, Editors, and Journalists groups exist and have the correct permissions assigned.

Permissions: - Reader: view Article/Newsletter/Publisher - Editor: view/change/delete Article & Newsletter + view Publisher - Journalist: add/view/change/delete Article & Newsletter + view Publisher

news_app.views.home(request)[source]

View to display the public home page.

news_app.views.is_editor(user)[source]

Helper function to check if the user is in Editors group.

news_app.views.is_journalist(user)[source]

Helper function to check if the user is in Journalists group.

news_app.views.is_reader(user)[source]

Helper function to check if the user is in Readers group.

news_app.views.login_user(request)[source]

Authenticate and log the user in.

news_app.views.logout_user(request)[source]

Log out the current user.

news_app.views.newsletter_create(request)[source]

Journalists can create newsletters.

news_app.views.newsletter_detail(request, newsletter_id)[source]

Newsletter detail view.

news_app.views.newsletter_edit(request, newsletter_id)[source]

Edit a newsletter. - Editors can edit any newsletter. - Journalists can edit only their own newsletters.

news_app.views.newsletter_list(request)[source]

List all newsletters.

news_app.views.register_user(request)[source]

Register a new user and assign them to a group based on their selected role.

news_app.views.subscriptions(request)[source]

Reader subscription management view.
